channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-2751] LocalOozieClient is missing methods from OozieClient
item.description:
LocalOozieClient works by wrapping direct calls to DagEngine in the normal OozieClient methods instead of making REST calls to an Oozie Server. However, it currently doesn't override all methods, which means you hit the OozieClient implementation, which tries to make a REST call and will fail (because it's not setup for that). For example, getStatus(String jobId) isn't overridden, and doesn't work when used from LocalOozieClient.

We should also create a test that verifies that all methods are overridden.
item.summary: LocalOozieClient is missing methods from OozieClient

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
rkanter From what you have mentioned and query in the user list.
LocalOozieClient should have following methods overridden: getStatus, dryrun, getJob(String, int, int), getJobDefinition, getWorkflowActionInfo, and Bulk operation commands (kill, suspend, resume).
Similarly we should improve the LocalOozieClientCoord for Coordinators.
I think we are missing the OozieClient implementation for BundleEngine.
Thanks.

abhishekbafna nice suggestions!

Once touched, I'd go for a small refactor that involves extracting an interface from OozieClient s methods that must be overridden, and let OozieClient, LocalOozieClient, and LocalOozieClientCoord implement that. That way it would be clear what is needed on what level.

I'd also extract the duplicated functionality from LocalOozieClient and LocalOozieClientCoord to a new class and let both ones use that w/ composition.
Thanks andras.piros.

Thank you andras.piros for your feedback and suggestion.

Though we are still casting the BaseEngine instance individually for each type (wf, coord and bundle) and operation (kill, suspend, resume). I believe, it will be good to use design pattern for the same. I will keep your suggestions in the next patch with little modification. I will add the required testcases and upload the patch for review. Thanks.

abhishekbafna yw We are still casting because we didn't want to touch existing operation etc. classes. I've looked into usages and we'd have to refactor quite many places if we did so.

Nevertheless, using double dispatch w/ Visitor pattern - that makes code more readable.

Thanks for the patches!

+1 (non-binding)

The full output of the test-patch run is available at

. https://builds.apache.org/job/oozie-trunk-precommit-build/3516/

It's unfortunate that the bulkModifyJobs methods return with JSONObject instead of things like WorkflowJob or whatever, but I guess we can't do anything about that

I would like if we added a test that would ensure that we don't have any public methods in OozieCLient that are not overridden in the local subclasses. (i.e. using reflection magic) This will prevent this sort of problem in the future.

Thanks rkanter for the feedback.

I am not sure test case will help, because some of the methods defined in OozieClient are very specific to Coordinators which are not overridden into LocalOozieClient and LocalOozieClientBundle e.g. reRunCoord, getCoordJobsInfo etc. At a higher level if we see then each of these LocalXXX classes implement only a specific set of methods.

Though a little more which can be done is overriding these methods into BaseLocalOozieClient and throwing a Exception as default implementation and their right behavior is overridden into their respective classes. Let me know me your further thoughts on this.

Throwing a helpful exception as the default in BaseLocalOozieClient sounds like a good idea. At the very least, the user will get a message saying that it's broken or to use the other type of local oozie client instead of whatever happens today (I forget now, but it was something not obvious).

Thanks rkanter. Attached the updated patch.
cc: andras.piros.
